item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configure a remote tunnelIf you created a Cloudflare Tunnel from the Zero Trust dashboard, the tunnel runs as a service on your OS. You can modify the Cloudflare Tunnel service with one or more configuration options. ​â€‹ Linux On Linux, Cloudflare Tunnel installs itself as a system service using systemctl. By default, the service will be named cloudflared.service. To configure your tunnel on Linux: Open cloudflared.service. $ sudo systemctl edit --full cloudflared.
